alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 17 at 11:17PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Elko has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Nevada... Maggie Creek Near Carlin affecting Elko County. For the Maggie Creek...including Carlin...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Maggie Creek Near Carlin. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 4.5 feet, Monitoring stage occurs. No flooding occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM PDT Monday the stage was 4.6 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 4.5 feet. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Location Stg Stg Day/Time Maggie Creek Carlin 5.0 4.6 Mon 10 pm &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at 330 PM PDT.
